newsitem.title: USA: NRC says restart for GPU's Pa. nuke still unclear.
newsitem.headline: NRC says restart for GPU's Pa. nuke still unclear.

text.p: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Friday it still has not approved restarting GPU Nuclear's Three Mile Island 1 power plant.
"They still haven't approved restart. There's a safety issue that still needs to be resolved," NRC spokesman Neil Sheeham said.
The 786 megawatt unit, in Londonderry, Pa., tripped off line June 21 after breakers failed on its output generator.
"That's resolved and ready to go...but they are still working on a design safety issue," he said.
Sheeham said the remaining issue involves making sure there is enough suction to run the sump pumps in the bottom of the reactor containment building if there were an accidental loss of coolant.
"GPU Nuclear is going to do some calculations and change water flow rate to solve the problem. They are still trying to work this out," Sheeham said.
He said the outage at this point is still open-ended, but that NRC restart approval could come at any time, "maybe even in a few hours."
GPU Nuclear, a subsidiary of GPU Inc, said earlier this week that they hoped to be able to restart the unit this weekend.
